examples: Throughout development, the most complex parts of our bodies get a literal headstart.
The literal challenge is beyond today's capacity.
We have a literal pandemic playbook.
The burning of so much coal, so quickly left behind a literal mark in the earth’s geohistory.
- They were literal quotes from you.
words.defineEn: (of a word or phrase) original or the most basic
words.defineVi: (của một từ hoặc cụm từ) nguyên bản hoặc cơ bản nhất

words.defineEn: (grammar) containing or denoting expressions that sound natural to a native speaker of a language
words.defineVi: (ngữ pháp) chứa hoặc biểu thị các cách diễn đạt nghe có vẻ tự nhiên đối với người bản ngữ của một ngôn ngữ

examples: I never thought you would carry out your threat.
The company was struggling because there were too many chiefs and not enough Indians to carry out the work.
Very few carry out these threats and those that do not, lose some credibility with their children who see them as all mouth and no action.
The flu always comes with aches and pains, making it difficult to move around and carry out daily tasks.
She was tempted to call his bluff, hardly able to believe he’d carry out his threat.
words.defineEn: to do a task
words.defineVi: để làm một nhiệm vụ

examples: She took up the cudgels for women's rights.
He took up the reins of government immediately after the coup.
He should take up a hobby.
Relatives have taken up the cudgels for two British women accused of murder.
After struggling with depression for years, taking up a new hobby like painting might do Jane a world of good.
words.defineEn: to begin or start doing something, such as a hobby, a task, or a new activity
words.defineVi: để bắt đầu hoặc bắt đầu làm điều gì đó, chẳng hạn như sở thích, nhiệm vụ hoặc hoạt động mới

examples: When the police informer saw a friend, he took off like a rat up a drainpipe.
He will make a fortune if his invention takes off.
I watched the planes take off and land from the observation deck at the airport.
I always feel excited when the airplane takes off.
He was embarrassed by his moobs while taking off his shirt at the beach.
words.defineEn: to remove a piece of clothing from one's or another's body
words.defineVi: để loại bỏ một mảnh quần áo từ cơ thể của một hoặc người khác

examples: I put on a clean pair of socks every morning.
He's just putting on an act for the boss's benefit.
He put on his leather jacket before heading out on his motorcycle.
He was always putting on airs and graces.
She put on her swimsuit and jumped into the pool.
words.defineEn: to put a piece of clothing on one's or someone else's body
words.defineVi: để đặt một mảnh quần áo trên cơ thể của một người hoặc người khác

examples: She grew up in the shadow of her very popular sister.
She grew up with Marmite as a staple in her household.
Grow up, it's just a game.
Growing up in the same neighborhood, the group of friends shared many experiences and interests, and as a result, they all tended to agree on many things.
The mother watched her children grow up and realized that time fleeth away without delay, reminding her to cherish every moment with them.
words.defineEn: to change from being a child into an adult little by little
words.defineVi: thay đổi từ một đứa trẻ thành một người lớn từng chút một

words.defineEn: to put our body in a flat position in order to sleep or rest
words.defineVi: để đặt cơ thể của chúng tôi ở một vị trí bằng phẳng để ngủ hoặc nghỉ ngơi

words.defineEn: to focus one's attention on something or someone in order to observe or examine them
words.defineVi: để tập trung sự chú ý của một người vào một cái gì đó hoặc ai đó để quan sát hoặc kiểm tra chúng

examples: Mary keeps lending money to her unreliable friend, even though she never gets paid back.
However, due to a law change, it hasn't been paid back.
While it doesn't protect them from having to pay back rent, it qualifies them for federal rental assistance to take care of it.
He was given a week to pay back the loan.
$525 of her income taxes goes to pay back the debt the government borrows to say afloat.
words.defineEn: to return an amount of money to its pervious owner
words.defineVi: để trả lại một số tiền cho chủ sở hữu cũ của nó

words.defineEn: to get rid of what is not needed or wanted anymore
words.defineVi: để loại bỏ những gì không cần thiết hoặc muốn nữa

examples: The treatment has not yet been tried on patients.
She tried on different hats at the store to find the perfect fit.
She tried on several dresses before finding the perfect one.
Now you try on the overalls.
But I am going to try on hearing aids for the first time today.
words.defineEn: to put on a piece of clothing to see if it fits and how it looks
words.defineVi: mặc một bộ quần áo để xem nó có vừa không và nó trông như thế nào

examples: He reached over and turned off his bedside light.
Jill must have been in another world when I asked her to turn off the oven because the bread is burned now.
"Turn off?"
Once inside, he turned off the security alarm.
Don't turn off the captions.
words.defineEn: to cause a machine, device, or equipment to stop operating, typically by pushing a button or turning a key
words.defineVi: làm cho máy móc, thiết bị hoặc thiết bị ngừng hoạt động, thường bằng cách nhấn nút hoặc vặn chìa khóa

examples: I put my neck on the line to get her a job in our company, and then she turns around and tries to steal my position!
The girls in front turned around and grinned.
I put my neck on the line to get her a job in our company, and then she turns around and tries to get me fired!
Turn around.
- Turn around.
words.defineEn: to turn something or ourselves in another direction
words.defineVi: để biến một cái gì đó hoặc chính chúng ta theo một hướng khác

examples: He picked up a beautiful head of savoy cabbage from the market.
They picked up the check for dinner last night.
Whenever we go out, my father picks up the tab.
The city had to pick up the pieces after a major storm caused widespread damage and power outages.
He picked up the new language easily by listening to podcasts.
words.defineEn: to take and lift something up
words.defineVi: để lấy và nâng một cái gì đó lên

examples: The old man gave up the ghost.
My poor old car finally gave up the ghost.
Ours has finally given up the ghost.
Er, don't give up the day job!
We gave up the right to use the valley.
words.defineEn: to stop trying when faced with failures or difficulties
words.defineVi: ngừng cố gắng khi đối mặt với thất bại hoặc khó khăn

words.defineEn: in small steps or portions; not all at once
words.defineVi: theo từng bước hoặc từng phần nhỏ; không phải tất cả cùng một lúc

examples: When the police informer saw a friend, he took off like a rat up a drainpipe.
He will make a fortune if his invention takes off.
I watched the planes take off and land from the observation deck at the airport.
I always feel excited when the airplane takes off.
He was embarrassed by his moobs while taking off his shirt at the beach.
words.defineEn: to leave a surface and begin flying
words.defineVi: để rời khỏi một bề mặt và bắt đầu bay

examples: The unexpected challenges became grist for the mill of their problem-solving skills.
Short hair really becomes you.
The child will become an adult.
The new office block has become an expensive white elephant.
The old government program has become a sacred cow.
words.defineEn: to start or grow to be
words.defineVi: để bắt đầu hoặc phát triển để được

examples: A successful investor has his finger on the pulse of international business.
She introduced her husband as a successful entrepreneur during the charity event.
We asked five successful writers to reveal some of the tricks of the trade.
He has made a fortune through his successful business ventures.
Emily's father went under the knife yesterday for a successful heart surgery.
words.defineEn: getting the results wanted or hoped
words.defineVi: nhận được kết quả mong muốn hoặc hy vọng

examples: The tech company's innovative new product is so far ahead of the curve that competitors will struggle to catch up.
Michael enjoys going out for coffee with his friends from work to catch up and unwind after a long day.
Others are catching up fast.
You're all caught up.
Some countries’ death rates have unfortunately caught up since then, which throws off the observed pattern.
words.defineEn: to acquire knowledge or information that was previously missed or overlooked, usually due to being behind or delayed in learning or staying informed
words.defineVi: để có được kiến thức hoặc thông tin mà trước đây đã bị bỏ lỡ hoặc bỏ qua, thường là do bị chậm trễ hoặc chậm trễ trong việc học hoặc cập nhật thông tin

examples: 95 per cent of the UK can now get superfast broadband.
This room gets very little sunshine.
Get a load of that dress Mag!
Get a load of George over there.
The police got wind of the illegal drug deal.
words.defineEn: to receive or come to have something
words.defineVi: để nhận hoặc đến để có một cái gì đó

words.defineEn: refering to something that is current, modern, or in accordance with the latest information, knowledge, or technology.
words.defineVi: đề cập đến một cái gì đó hiện tại, hiện đại hoặc phù hợp với thông tin, kiến thức hoặc công nghệ mới nhất.

examples: For 10 years she looked after her children, with her career very much on the back burner.
I'll look after Jamie while you go shopping.
John has been up to his knees looking after the kids lately.

words.defineEn: to be in charge of someone and attend to their needs or to take care of something
words.defineVi: chịu trách nhiệm về ai đó và đáp ứng nhu cầu của họ hoặc chăm sóc một cái gì đó

examples: The baby had chubby cheeks and a cute face.
The baby cried its head off.

The lioness carefully groomed her newborn baby.
words.defineEn: a child who is very young, usually too young to walk or speak
words.defineVi: một đứa trẻ còn rất nhỏ, thường còn quá nhỏ để đi hoặc nói

She held it, cast an eye over it and looked up at Harry suspiciously.
The girl looks up.
words.defineEn: to try to find information in a dictionary, computer, etc.
words.defineVi: để cố gắng tìm thông tin trong từ điển, máy tính, v.v.

words.defineEn: (grammar) a unit of language that has a specific meaning
words.defineVi: (ngữ pháp) một đơn vị ngôn ngữ có ý nghĩa cụ thể

words.defineVi: để hoàn thành tất cả của một cái gì đó và không có nữa

Oh, and your teeth fall out.

words.defineVi: không còn thân thiện với ai đó do tranh cãi

examples: Someone has taken my scarf.

examples: She often gets on her soapbox about environmental issues.
she gets on the stick very quickly.
It really gets on my nerves.

words.defineEn: to have a good, friendly, or smooth relationship with a person, group, or animal
words.defineVi: để có một mối quan hệ tốt, thân thiện, hoặc suôn sẻ với một người, nhóm, hoặc động vật

examples: The horse took the first fence well.

The car holds the corners very well.
The glue is taking well.
In this grim little episode, few people come out well.
words.defineEn: in a way that is right, good, or satisfactory
